title: POLICE BLOTTER: WPD charges victim in Tuesday shooting
content:
After an investigation, it was determined the juvenile shot himself while in a vehicle, according to the Wilmington Police Department.
WILMINGTON -- A 15-year-old validated gang member was charged Tuesday in a shooting in which he injured himself, according to the Wilmington Police Department.
The shooting was reported at 1:26 p.m. near the intersection of Castle and 15th streets.
WPD spokeswoman Cathryn Lindsay said officers were dispatched to the area in reference to a male juvenile being struck by a stray bullet. When officers and emergency personnel arrived, they found the teenager with a gunshot wound to his upper thigh area.
He was taken to New Hanover Regional Medical Center with non-life-threatening injuries, Lindsay said.
After an investigation, it was determined the juvenile shot himself while in a vehicle, Lindsay said. He then called 911 and reported he was struck by a stray bullet, she said.
The teenager has been charged with discharging a firearm within city limits, possession of a handgun by a minor and filing a false police report, according to the police department.
